vn.map4d.map.core.gestures

Class MoveGestureDetector

  • java.lang.Object
    • vn.map4d.map.core.gestures.BaseGesture<L>
      • vn.map4d.map.core.gestures.MultiFingerGesture<L>
        • vn.map4d.map.core.gestures.ProgressiveGesture<MoveGestureDetector.OnMoveGestureListener>
          • vn.map4d.map.core.gestures.MoveGestureDetector

  • @UiThread
public class MoveGestureDetector
extends ProgressiveGesture<MoveGestureDetector.OnMoveGestureListener>
    Gesture detector handling move gesture.

    MoveGestureDetector serves similar purpose to #onScroll(MotionEvent, MotionEvent, float, float), however, it's a ProgressiveGesture that introduces MoveGestureDetector.OnMoveGestureListener.onMoveBegin(MoveGestureDetector), MoveGestureDetector.OnMoveGestureListener.onMoveEnd(MoveGestureDetector, float, float), threshold with setMoveThreshold(float) and multi finger support thanks to MoveDistancesObject.

      • getMoveThreshold

        public float getMoveThreshold()
        Get the delta pixel threshold required to qualify it as a move gesture.
        Returns:
        delta pixel threshold
        See Also:
        getMoveThresholdRect()

      • setMoveThreshold

        public void setMoveThreshold(float moveThreshold)
        Set the delta pixel threshold required to qualify it as a move gesture.

        We encourage to set those values from dimens to accommodate for various screen sizes.

        Parameters:
        moveThreshold - delta threshold
        See Also:
        setMoveThresholdRect(RectF)

      • getMoveThresholdRect

        @Nullable
public android.graphics.RectF getMoveThresholdRect()
        Get the screen area in which the move gesture cannot be started. If the gesture is already in progress, this value is ignored. This condition is evaluated before setMoveThreshold(float).
        Returns:
        the screen area in which the gesture cannot be started

      • setMoveThresholdRect

        public void setMoveThresholdRect(@Nullable
                                 android.graphics.RectF moveThresholdRect)
        Set the screen area in which the move gesture cannot be started. If the gesture is already in progress, this value is ignored. This condition is evaluated before setMoveThreshold(float).
        Parameters:
        moveThresholdRect - the screen area in which the gesture cannot be started

      • getLastDistanceX

        public float getLastDistanceX()

        Returns:

      • getLastDistanceY

        Returns:
        Y distance of the focal point in pixel

      • getMoveObject

        public MoveDistancesObject getMoveObject(int pointerIndex)
        Returns MoveDistancesObject referencing the pointer held under passed index.

        Pointers are sorted by the time they were placed on the screen until lifted up. This means that index 0 will reflect the oldest added, still active pointer and index (MultiFingerGesture.getPointersCount() - 1) will reflect the latest added, still active pointer.

        Parameters:
        pointerIndex - pointer's index
        Returns:
        distances object of the referenced pointer
